newsitem.title: JAPAN: Link sought in Japan murder of two U.S. Navy wives.
newsitem.headline: Link sought in Japan murder of two U.S. Navy wives.

text.p: The U.S. Navy has formed a special task force to investigate the murders in the past two months of two wives of sailors while they were at sea on the aircraft carrier Independence. a U.S. Navy spokesman said on Wednesday.
The spokesman said it was too early to say if the murders were linked.
In the first killing on March 15, Wakana Brock, 24, was found strangled in her home near the Yokosuka navy base, home port of the Independence, which has been at sea since February 15.
On Monday, Gloria Morris, 29, was found stabbed to death in her home on the Atsugi Naval Air Facility.
The two bases are about 25 km (15 miles) apart near Tokyo.
"It's too early to say if the incidents are linked or not. No suspect has been found for the March killing," the spokesman said.
Both husbands were at sea on the Independence when the murders happened, he added.
